question.body: What would happen to heart rate in a person with an epinephrine secreting tumor (called a pheochromocytoma)? Epinephrine is one of the transmitters of the sympathetic nervous system.

response.feedback: Incorrect. A heart rate decrease would be associated with the parasympathetic nervous system and epinephrine is released with activation of the sympathetic nervous system.
Incorrect. Heart rate would likely change significantly.
Correct. Epinephrine will increase the depolarization rate of the SA node, leading to a higher heart rate.

part.hint: Consider the conditions that typically activate the sympathetic branch of the autonomic nervous system.
